TITLE: Bill Cosby plans to tour in 2023 even as he faces a new sexual assault lawsuit
SUMMARY: The news of his tour plans comes just weeks after five women filed another sexual assault lawsuit against the 85-year-old comedian.

TITLE: A court in Myanmar again finds Aung San Suu Kyi guilty of corruption
SUMMARY: A court's conviction against Aung San Suu Kyi leaves her with 33 years to serve in prison following a series of politically tinged prosecutions since her government was toppled in February 2021.

TITLE: New York opens its first legal recreational marijuana dispensary
SUMMARY: The first legal dispensary for recreational marijuana in New York rung up its first sales on Thursday, opening up what is expected to be one of the country's most lucrative markets for cannabis.

TITLE: U.S. says Chinese intercept could have caused air collision
SUMMARY: The U.S. military said that the incident occurred Dec. 21 when a Chinese jet fighter flew in front of and within 6 meters (20 feet) of the nose of a U.S. military reconnaissance plane.

TITLE: 2022 was a big year for EV battery plants in the U.S. How big? $73 billion big
SUMMARY: As the auto industry goes electric, there have been so many massive battery projects announced that it can be hard to keep track of them all. So we added them up for you.

TITLE: 3 prime ministers, 2 monarchs, 1 year: This was Britain's tumultuous 2022
SUMMARY: 2022 was the year in which Great Britain lost its queen of seven decades, gained a new king and saw three prime ministers take office. The year concluded with multiple strikes and inflation near 11%.

TITLE: Why scientists dug up the father of genetics, Gregor Mendel, and analyzed his DNA
SUMMARY: The year 2022 was the 200th anniversary of the birth of Gregor Mendel. He's known as the father of genetics, so scientists exhumed Mendel's body and examined his DNA.

TITLE: Flight fare prices skyrocketed following Southwest's meltdown. Was it price gouging?
SUMMARY: Passengers who looked for last-minute tickets encountered sky-high prices — in some cases, triple or quadruple the rate for the same route in the last few months. Experts say it's fairly normal.

TITLE: The U.S. says Chinese intercept could have caused an air collision
SUMMARY: The U.S. military said that the incident occurred Dec. 21 when a Chinese jet fighter flew in front of and within 20 feet of the nose of a U.S. military reconnaissance plane.

TITLE: Editors' picks: Our best global photos of 2022 range from heart-rending to hopeful
SUMMARY: The eye of the camera told the stories of kangaroo care for human babies, Angola's intrepid female de-miners, Ukrainian refugees who find a warm — and familiar — welcome in Brazil and more.

TITLE: Epstein's sex trafficking was aided by JPMorgan, a U.S. Virgin Islands lawsuit says
SUMMARY: The U.S.V.I. says JPMorgan Chase didn't report Jeffrey Epstein's suspicious financial activities and provided him banking services after his 2008 conviction for soliciting a minor.

TITLE: Pritzker-winning architect Arata Isozaki dies at 91
SUMMARY: The Japanese architect was known as a post-modern giant who blended culture and history of the East and the West in his designs. He won the Pritzker Prize, the highest honor in the field, in 2019.

TITLE: Intense cold strained, but didn't break, the U.S. electric grid. That was lucky
SUMMARY: An intense cold snap caused rolling blackouts in some regions. But a more profound catastrophe didn't unfold, thanks partly to good fortune.

TITLE: A suspect in the deaths of 4 University of Idaho students is arrested in Pennsylvania
SUMMARY: Bryan Christopher Kohberger, 28, is being held for extradition in the criminal homicide investigation. The students were stabbed to death at a home near campus in the early morning hours of Nov. 13.

TITLE: China's new foreign minister will be Qin Gang, the current ambassador to Washington
SUMMARY: China's diplomacy will offer "Chinese wisdom, Chinese initiatives and Chinese strength," Qin said in his first statement as foreign minister. He is seen as one of Xi Jinping's trusted aides.

TITLE: China's COVID vaccines: Do the jabs do the job?
SUMMARY: As case counts surge in China, rumors circulate about the effectiveness and safety of the made-in-China vaccines in use there. Here's what we know about CoronaVac and Sinopharm.

TITLE: House Democrats release Trump's tax returns
SUMMARY: The Democratic-controlled Ways and Means Committee has released former President Trump's tax returns from his time in office, ending a multi-year legal battle for the information.

TITLE: The EPA finalizes a water-protection rule that repeals Trump-era changes
SUMMARY: The Biden administration finalized regulations that protect small streams, wetlands and other waterways, repealing a Trump-era rule that environmentalists said left waterways vulnerable to pollution.

TITLE: Who is Andrew Tate? Your guide to the self-styled misogynist influencer
SUMMARY: Tate, a highly controversial social media celebrity, started his week as the butt of a joke by Greta Thunberg and ended it by reportedly getting arrested in Romania. Here's what you need to know.

TITLE: Arizona's AG says dropping Title 42 would cause border 'chaos'
SUMMARY: Mark Brnovich led the fight to keep Title 42 in place. He explains to NPR why he and other state AGs want to keep it in effect until the surge of migrants at the southern border is under control.

TITLE: Hershey's faces a lawsuit over heavy metals in its dark chocolate bars
SUMMARY: The lawsuit comes after Consumer Reports sounded the alarm about dangerous heavy metals in dark chocolate bars from manufactures like Lindt, Ghirardelli and Hershey's.

TITLE: Biden grants 6 full pardons as the year comes to a close
SUMMARY: President Biden granted clemency to six individuals on Friday who were convicted of a range of crimes.

TITLE: What we know about the University of Idaho stabbings
SUMMARY: The authorities arrested a suspect, 28-year-old Bryan Christopher Kohberger, on Friday.

TITLE: Brazilians remember Pelé for the 'sense of identity' he gave them
SUMMARY: "He leaves a legacy, a person of color who was crowned king of soccer, and he also brought a lot of peace outside Brazil," says Jorge Tavares, a resident of the late soccer legend's home state.

TITLE: 5 things to know about Southwest's disastrous meltdown
SUMMARY: Why did Southwest cancel so many flights, and what's next for affected travelers? The airline-in-crisis hasn't answered all the questions, but claims it has returned to normal operations.

TITLE: Cristiano Ronaldo signs with a Saudi soccer club
SUMMARY: The announcement, a groundbreaking deal for Middle Eastern soccer, ends speculation about where he would go next. Ronaldo became a free agent after his contract was terminated by Manchester United.

TITLE: Trailblazing journalist Barbara Walters has died at 93
SUMMARY: Over more than a half century, the driven celebrity journalist built one of the most remarkable careers in TV news. She was 93.

TITLE: An Arizona court rules abortion doctors can't be prosecuted under pre-statehood law
SUMMARY: The law in question was enacted before Arizona became a state, carrying a sentence of two to five years in prison for anyone who assists in an abortion and providing no exceptions for rape or incest.

TITLE: North Korea fires 3 missiles amid tensions over drone flights
SUMMARY: Tensions rose earlier this week when South Korea accused North Korea of flying five drones across the border for the first time in five years and responded by sending its own drones toward the North.

TITLE: A series of storms are forecast for California that could bring flooding
SUMMARY: A series of storms are poised to usher in the new year with downpours and potential flooding across much of the state and multiple feet of snow in the Sierra Nevada.

TITLE: Ian Tyson, half of the folk duo Ian & Sylvia, has died at age 89
SUMMARY: The Canadian folk singer wrote the modern standard "Four Strong Winds" as one half of Ian & Sylvia and helped influence such future superstars as Joni Mitchell and Neil Young.

TITLE: Court rules doctors who provide abortions can't be prosecuted under Arizona law
SUMMARY: The law in question was enacted before Arizona became a state, carrying a sentence of two to five years in prison for anyone who assists in an abortion and providing no exceptions for rape or incest.

TITLE: In Afghanistan, coal mining relies on the labor of children
SUMMARY: Since the return of the Taliban, Afghanistan's coal exports have increased — and so has child labor. At a coal mine in Baghlan province, boys earn between $3 and $8 for a day's work.

TITLE: These were the top political stories of 2022
SUMMARY: There was a lot that happened in politics this year, from the consequential midterm elections to the Supreme Court's historic abortion ruling and record migration at the southern border.

TITLE: War against Ukraine has left Russia isolated and struggling — with more tumult ahead
SUMMARY: Russia will end 2022 in a weaker global standing than when the year began. Its struggles in Ukraine surprised the Kremlin, and the global punishments are starting to hamper the Russian economy.

TITLE: Retired Pope Benedict XVI dies at 95
SUMMARY: He is remembered as a staunch conservative who opposed modernizing reforms and as the first pope to step down since the 15th century.

TITLE: Burst pipes in Jackson, Mississippi, are just the latest of the city's water woes
SUMMARY: Officials have been struggling for months to patch up an "old, crumbling system" while planning for a more permanent fix.

TITLE: The future of migrants in El Paso remains uncertain as border restrictions continue
SUMMARY: Migrants have traveled hundreds, if not thousands, of miles to the Mexican border in a search of a better life. Many are turning themselves over to U.S. border authorities and seeking asylum.

TITLE: Is there mercury in the fish we eat? Amazonians tap WhatsApp to find out
SUMMARY: A community of Indigenous peoples worried that mercury used by gold miners was contaminating the fish they eat. So they created a DIY team to find out more.

TITLE: Russia launches a wave of missiles at Ukraine in a massive New Year's Eve air attack
SUMMARY: At least one person was killed and several injured in Kyiv after Russia launched a new wave of missiles against the capital and other cities across Ukraine.

TITLE: He lost his legs fighting for Ukraine. But this story is about love through adversity
SUMMARY: Sgt. Mykhailo Varvarych, a commander in Ukraine's 80th Airborne Assault Brigade, lost both legs while fighting in Luhansk. He and his fiancée Iryna Botvynska, maintain an unflinching romance.

TITLE: Mega Millions jackpot hits $785 million in time for the first drawing of 2023
SUMMARY: After no ticket matched the six numbers drawn Friday, the $785 million jackpot will proceed to the next ticket drawing Tuesday.

TITLE: Why retired pope Benedict's funeral will be so unusual
SUMMARY: Benedict was the first pope to step down in nearly 600 years, creating a rare relationship between a sitting and former pope.

TITLE: Argentines have tattoo fever following World Cup triumph
SUMMARY: Argentina's victory in the soccer World Cup tournament in Qatar has suddenly meant that many tattoo artists across the country are fully booked.

TITLE: Cities across the world ring in the new year
SUMMARY: From Sydney to Bangkok, time zones across the world have already entered 2023.

TITLE: Buccaneers quarterback Blaine Gabbert helps rescue a family from a helicopter crash
SUMMARY: Often in the background as Tom Brady's backup, Gabbert is gaining national attention for helping rescue four people in the water after a helicopter crash in Florida.

TITLE: Countries across the world ring in the new year
SUMMARY: From Bangkok to Berlin, one time zone at a time celebrated the entry into 2023.
